A full count of the #LDV NNR on Monday revealed a total of 16,834 wildfowl, inc. 15 White-fronts, 200 Pink-feet, 6 Barnacles and 9 Egyptian Geese. 133 Shelduck, 7820 Wigeon, 6550 Teal and an impressive build-up of 633 Pintail were also recorded @YorkBirding

The @EnvAgency allows staff to own shares in the water industry. It did not know their roles but requires staff to make an annual conflict declaration.  The results most closely matching such shares owned by staff in 2018 was 107 and in part of 2019 was 80 @bwebster135

At the same time as this letter was sent by the Chair of one Agency, @ProspectUnion (which represents civil servants) was making a similar case for Natural England, warning in particular of the consequences for SSSIs of long-term cuts. https://t.co/4UiCK93PMo

@EnvAgency Important to recognise beaver can also increase flood risk in certain situations e.g. undermine river embankments in lowland areas just like other large burrowing animals. Why ADA continues to advocate a careful managed approach to reintroduction learning from practices in Europe

tweets.text:
Congratulations to Sally Gallagher, a groundwater specialist in the North East, who has been recognised with an MBE in the New Year Honours for protecting communities and safeguarding the environment. 

It's very well deserved and we're delighted! 

#NewYear2021 
#MBE https://t.co/4B9uF42D0N

BEMs to Tom Fowler for services to the Environment, Deborah Campbell for services to Flood Protection and voluntary service to Young People, and Chris Pedlar for services to Prostate Cancer Awareness. #TeamEA @EnvAgency (2/3)

urls.title: Why 2020 has been good for England's beavers
urls.description: Homes for these "ultimate environmental engineers" have been set up in enclosures across England.

tweets.text:
2020 has been a good year for beavers in England! The canals and dams beavers build alleviate flood risk and create wetlands for other species. 

400 years ago they were hunted to extinction, find out about the successes we've seen in their reintroduction: https://t.co/JSWh5o63Kd
On 31/12/20 at 02:30 the river level was 0.46m. https://t.co/X2iKTgUgQY

tweets.text:
So delighted for my friend and colleague, Sally Gallagher, awarded an MBE today for her work protecting the groundwater environment of NE England @EnvAgencyYNE 
https://t.co/WCDd6xs4Fh

The @EnvAgency  Target for inspecting sewage works in Thames region in 2017 was on average once every EIGHT YEARS. Target 33 achieved 17. Still the leadership cut the monitoring staff. Wondering where it all went wrong? @EmmaHowardBoyd
‚ÄúThe Bad‚Äù https://t.co/jwxkoohxuG

And @EnvAgency Board Member and Chief Executive of @EsmeeFairbairn Caroline Mason CBE (@LineyMason) has been recognised with a damehood "for services to the Charity Sector, particularly during the COVID-19 response". #TeamEA Huge congratulations to them all. (3/3)

tweets.text:
Last week, after high tides #TeamEA dug out the tidal outfall at Hest Bank #Lancaster 

Our teams work 24/7, 365 days of the year not only to #ReduceFloodRisk but on any environmental incident. 

Report environmental incidents to us on 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/FLGacivhnH
Would you know what to do in the event of a flood? Watch this video from the @EnvAgency - knowing just one thing could safe your life üíô  #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xmtEB7Ik0F

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/HCws1Z2qjR

entity.name: New Years Eve
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for New Years Eve for all years.

tweets.text:
Today is my last working day at the @EnvAgency after 25 years. Thanks for all the memories and friends I‚Äôve made along the way.

Bring on the new year, new organisation, and new job.

River #flooding is possible in parts of central and east England.

Stay alert and keep away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd https://t.co/53N5yBFIDE
Continuation of weed cutting on the River Eau by @GroundControlGC for the @EnvAgencyMids making good progress, flow already better to help flood prevention. https://t.co/Dq2ZQNTB1r

It may well be snowing in some parts of our region this morning, but we have have quite a few flood alerts and warnings in force. 

Get the latest and our advice on staying safe and dry here: https://t.co/m0cqHfULbD
#floodaware

Flood warnings and alerts are in place in much of Oxfordshire.

üîçSearch for warnings and alerts near you https://t.co/Jc9hMf6wuH

üö®What to do in an emergency https://t.co/lIwXZCHi7u

Follow @EnvAgencySE for updates, stay safe and take action now if you need to.

@bradfordmdc @CanalRiverTrust @YWHelp @YorksWildlife @EnvAgencyYNE With parts of the River Wharfe in Ilkley to become the first river bathing site in England. Will emergency throwline boards be installed at this location?

Do you want the River Stour to be a wildlife-rich source of pride for the communities of the Black Country and all those who visit it? If YES, please comment using the hashtag #BBCWildlifexEcover & RT. Each share is a vote for us to win funding from @EcoverUK #FertilisetheFuture https://t.co/jDvTG2EcIB
